html: Having been born into the covenant blessings of wealth and privilege, the rising generation of Jehovah’s people—here identified as a Jacob/Israel category—now faces poverty and scarcity. Although former harvests were plentiful, the earth’s “harvest” of Jehovah’s Day of Judgment sees the few elect who remain gathered out like mere “gleanings” from such an abundance before covenant curses become irrevocable ( Isaiah 24:13; 27:12-13). The rest of Jehovah’s people—those of Jacob/Israel who don’t repent and return—seek to survive in what literally becomes a valley of “rephaim ” or “ghosts.”
